title: Trump revives imperialism à la Teddy Roosevelt
summary: Donald Trump's positioning on Greenland and the Panama Canal echoes the Monroe Doctrine, which established the 'Western Hemisphere' as an area of US hegemony.

title: Nicolas Maduro sworn in as Venezuela's president amid global outcry
summary: Maduro will now start his third 6-year term, despite claims of election fraud and voter repression.

title: Trump sentenced to 'unconditional discharge' for hush money conviction
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump was sentenced Friday in his hush money case, but the judge declined to impose any punishment.

title: Controversy over management of Los Angeles fires intensifies
summary: With less than 12 days to go before the administration change in Washington, Democrats are seeking to show that they have the situation under control.

title: Sarkozy attacks 'liars and swindlers' in first statement at Libyan campaign financing trial
summary: 'There is no corruption money because there was no corruption of the candidate,' the former French president assured a Paris court.

title: Syrian transitional cabinet is stocked with Ahmed al-Sharaa's loyalists
summary: The country's strongman has surrounded himself with close associates, former jihadists and conservative Islamist technocrats with whom he governed the province of Idlib.

title: Navy veteran cleared of conspiracy charges in high-profile January 6 case is sentenced to time served
summary: Thomas Caldwell's attorney told US District Judge Amit Mehta in court documents that his client's acquittal on the conspiracy charges and 'military service that resulted in a lifetime of debilitating injuries' call for a sentence of time served. He spent more than 50 days behind bars after his 2021 arrest.

title: FBI must be independent and above the partisan fray, outgoing director says in farewell address
summary: Christopher Wray has announced his intent to resign ahead of Trump's inauguration on January 20, roughly three years short of the 10-year tenure given to FBI directors. The move followed Trump's statement that he would install Patel, a former Justice Department prosecutor who has sharply criticized FBI investigations into Trump

title: TikTok ban in the US: What can we expect from the Supreme Court hearing?
summary: A hearing is taking place on Friday before the US's highest court, which will have to decide between defending freedom of expression and national security. President-elect Donald Trump now wants to avoid shutting down the app.

title: Syrian transitional cabinet is stocked with Ahmed al-Sharaa's loyalists
summary: The country's strongman has surrounded himself with close associates, former jihadists and conservative Islamist technocrats with whom he governed the province of Idlib.

title: Biden extends US stay for Venezuelans, Salvadorans
summary: 'Temporary protected status' (TPS) is granted to foreign citizens who cannot safely return home because of war, natural disasters or other 'extraordinary' conditions. The move comes less than 10 days before the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump, who has pledged to carry out a mass deportation of migrants after taking office.

title: Paris says Algeria 'seeking to humiliate France'
summary: The rift between Paris and Algiers grew wider on Friday, after France arrested four Algerian influencers and Algeria continued its detention of French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal.

title: 2024, the hottest year on record and the first to exceed the 1.5°C global warming threshold
summary: The main cause of overheating is the accumulation of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, mainly due to the burning of coal, oil and gas. This has led to an increase in heatwaves, floods, droughts and fires.

title: The threat of intermediate-range missiles returns to Europe
summary: The launch of a Russian intermediate-range ballistic missile at Ukraine in late November 2024 is forcing Western nations to consider redeveloping IRBMs, whose use had been banned at the end of the Cold War.

title: Diplomatic gulf between France and Algeria widens
summary: By questioning Algeria's 'honor' over the arrest of a French-Algerian writer, French President Emmanuel Macron is rekindling tension between the two countries.

title: On X, Elon Musk normalizes the German far right
summary: For over an hour on January 9, the AfD chancellery candidate spoke live to the American billionaire, evoking a 'communist' Hitler and the 'huge side effects' of vaccines.

title: Zurich, European 'capital of expats': A blessing or a curse?
summary: The Swiss metropolis is now Europe's top destination for high-income foreign professionals. While they fuel the local economy, they’re also pushing up rents and driving gentrification in traditionally working-class neighborhoods.

title: Kremlin says Putin ready for talks with Trump
summary: Trump has repeatedly said he can bring a swift end to the nearly three-year conflict between Russia and Ukraine, without presenting a concrete plan.

title: Furikake makes its comeback in Japan
summary: Once considered 'vulgar,' the culinary topping sprinkled over rice is experiencing a sharp rise in sales. Tourists are drawn to the variety of flavors and its affordable price appeals to households hit by inflation.

title: In Syria, the new government is grappling with Southern armed factions
summary: After meeting several times with Syria's new strongman, Ahmed al-Sharaa, some 40 factions from the south signed an agreement with the transitional authorities for their integration into a command under the Ministry of Defense's control.

title: In Bangladesh, French brands criticized for failing to protect workers' rights
summary: Suppliers of 45 brands, including Zara, H&M, Kiabi Decathlon and Carrefour, have been singled out by NGOs for filing complaints against their employees following the protests of 2023.

title: The turbulent history of the French left's divisions over Islam and secularism since 'Charlie Hebdo' attack
summary: Over the last 10 years, the gulf between the Socialists and Jean-Luc Mélenchon's radical-left has widened.

title: US weather service estimates total Los Angeles fire damage between $135-150 billion so far
summary: The scale of damage to the second-biggest US city could be the costliest ever recorded, according to AccuWeather. The five separate fires have so far burned more than 35,000 acres (14,000 hectares), California's fire agency reported.

title: Franz Ferdinand's fertile fears
summary: The Scottish band's sixth album, 'The Human Fear,' imagines new pop landscapes.

title: Trump avoids sentence in 'hush money' case
summary: No prison, no fine. The president-elect of the United States, found guilty of trying to buy Stormy Daniels' silence, has been only symbolically convicted.

title: Syria's HTS 'is a movement that has de-radicalized from the top'
summary: A leading expert on Syria, researcher Patrick Haenni analyzes the nature of the new power stemming from the Hayat Tahrir al-Sham group, and the strategic and security challenges facing the new authorities in Damascus.

title: Who is Joseph Aoun, Lebanon's new president?
summary: The former army chief, a favorite of Washington, Paris and Riyadh, says he wants to rebuild his country, currently in tatters.

title: Paris-Algiers tensions heighten over failed expulsion of Algerian influencer
summary: France's interior minister accused Algeria of seeking to 'humiliate France,' saying the country will have 'no option but to retaliate' should 'the Algerians continue this posture of escalation.'
